title: On Riven and the Runic Blade Resource Bar
body:
Dear Riot, and all players who would like to weigh in,

A while ago, I saw a player suggest a quality-of-life change to Riven that would occupy her resource bar with an indicator of her Runic Blade (passive) charges. I remember that a Rioter noticed the suggestion and mentioned that it would be an interesting way to use her otherwise-empty resource bar. Like I said, this was a long time ago, and I haven't seen hide or hair of this change since. I figured I would check up on the idea and see what people's thoughts were today. Do people still think this would be a nice thing to have? Is it entirely necessary for Riven to show her stacks more obviously than on her buff bar? What if you're not playing Riven, but playing alongside/against her? Would it be helpful for you to know this information?

-Tact

replies.body:
We did give this a try and ultimately ended to not do this as it causes a number of consistency issues. It was a while ago and my memory on it is a bit fuzzy since I wasn't working directly on it but iirc what is came down to was the resource bar is fundamentally meant to function as a *resource bar*, doubling up on the buff bar goes against a pretty solid rule of thumb in UI/EX design which is limit special cases in UI and avoid duplication. Breaking consistency here has a huge long term cost that can be difficult to quantify. 

From a gameplay perspective, the resource bar is meant to be a relatively stable and slowish moving bar showing a characters relative strength, current threat level, and reveal their general flow of attrition (how long it takes to be exhausted). Seeing a champion low on energy or mana means they have limited casts available to them and is a moment of weakness enemies can exploit. In this case for the opponent this bar would be incredibly misleading with Riven being ***most dangerous*** but also ***most vulnerable*** when this bar is empty. With some weird middle ground of when partially full you're most likely being killed. 

The second important gameplay element is that there should have some level of consistency and flow in the resource bar. Rarely do mana or energy users dump their entire bar in one go, while Riven can cause the bar to fill and empty in only a second or two. It can be incredibly tempting to see an open spot on a UI and want to fill it (believe me I've been there, as a mechanics designer I want to cram as much information as I can pretty much everywhere) but there is a steep clarity and readability cost which increases exponentially each time you break. Sometimes this cost can totally be worth it, in this specific case we didn't feel it was. I would love to explore the space of custom UI elements only the player controlling the character can see/interact with though, and this seems like a logical candidate for that.

Well that pretty much contradicts every non-Mana/Energy use of the secondary resource bar. 

Battle Fury, Rage, Ferocity and Heat are not resources; Rumble and Renekton are definitely more likely to kill you when their bars are partially full. Dragon Fury is a resource only used by one ability, but it only really represents a timer (and an inaccurate one, since she can add time while using it). Flow and Iron Man are shields - if Mordekaiser has no shield then it likely means he's currently in a state of being the most dangerous (since his abilities are up) and also most vulnerable. 

I digress I don't think Riven is the best person to utilize the resource bar (I think Vlad's Tides of Blood should be given the Battle Fury treatment and have him generate 25 stacks per cast and have it constantly decay) - but if you added some icons that visually tie in with the runes on her sword — so each ability would light up a rune — it would look cool. Make it not look like a resource.

Yasuo and Mordekaiser both say hi. Their "resource" bar is definitely fast moving not slow moving, and honestly it says nothing about how easily they can kill you or not. 

Then you have people that use Rage or other resources, or better yet Rengar that fills his at a stead pace up to 5 then instantly empties it.

> We did give this a try and ultimately ended to not do this as it causes a number of consistency issues. It was a while ago and my memory on it is a bit fuzzy since I wasn't working directly on it but iirc what is came down to was the resource bar is fundamentally meant to function as a *resource bar*, doubling up on the buff bar goes against a pretty solid rule of thumb in UI/EX design which is limit special cases in UI and avoid duplication. Breaking consistency here has a huge long term cost that can be difficult to quantify. 

Then you should remove the stun timer from the resource bar. It is not a resource.

I don't think it's necessary per say, but I think it would be a good teaching tool. People who know how to weave autos in between her abilities now wouldn't be affected at all, but someone jut starting to pick her up will probably have a little easier of time realizing "hey I should use some of these charges before my next cast so I don't waste them".

I wouldn't worry too much about it not coming up just yet though, they just got around to Varus' Q having a line indicator and I've seen that being asked for awhile as well.

Overall, good idea imho.
That's what a QoF (Quality of Life) Change is, nothing really game changing, but just helps making the learning/awareness process easier
I think it could be very helpful, though I can usually track my runic charges in my head without much effort. The real question is what color would it be?

Green of course.
I loved this idea last time and love it this time. Upvoted.
Well actually it would be amazing if it was like her blade and has patterns in it

They have a similar thing with Rengar, but if they do add this, I hope that they add dividers to the bar. that would add more clarity and I prefer to see chunks than a fluid bar. Sometimes I can't tell if the enemy/ally Rengar have 2 or 3 stacks.

Wouldn't it give away that info to the enemy? Like with Shyvana. They'd know not to engage while she's full.

I dunno, Riven's different, but it's something to think about.
It shows up on her buff/debuff bar anyway. How is a visible resource bar any different from clicking on her and looking at the target frame in the top left of the screen?
.....You just described exactly how it's different.

The only way it's "different" is that it's better communicated to both players. Riot's been all about "oooo clarity" lately (cough cough jungle timers), so this seems pretty in line with what they've been doing.
It coulf confuse newer players that think they are losing something when they auto, as well the fact that it would rise and fall rather quickly.
It could be similar to Renekton or tryndamere

Going on that note, I really want Garen to have a Demacia meter, to measure how Demacia his Demacia is. Because I really want to know how Demacia he gets when he Q,W,E or Rs.

Also. DEMACIA {{champion:86}}

I think it would just be a nice simple Quality of life change. It would help for new players who have not had the experience of paying with/against her. At higher levels it won't really be that big of a difference since Riven players and those laning against her should know to keep track of that anyways. And if they made the resource bar look Green with the same runes on her sword I think it would be the sickest looking resource bar in the game.

This would be pretty helpful, there is really not any downside I can think of. It would just be easier to see the charges on the resource bar as it would help her and her opponent know when she has charges.
I think it would be very helpful to play agaisnt so you know how much she has saved up and as her I can just look down and not have to find the correct buff if I have lets say 10 buffs on me
I think it'd be nice, allow both players to realize that Riven has stacks, and will hit harder.

While this sounds great from a gameplay perspective, it would be god-awful from a graphic design perspective. Riven can gain and lose a full bar in less than a second. The bar would literally be flashing back and forth, as some charges are spent milleseconds after they are obtained (auto Q combo).
